history.text: Good morning
Good Morning. How are you today?
Doing well, and you?
Very good, thank you.
Have you seen the film 'The Post'?
I have not. Is it about the mail system?
Actually, no, it is about the Washington Post, a newspaper
The film is set in the early 70's, when journalists where attempting to publish the Pentagon Papers
I know that is a huge Newspaper, but unfortunately can't say I read it.
I love new movies that are set at older dates, that really give you the true details of how things get started.
Who is the main character?
The main characters are played by Meryl Streep and Tom Hanks
Two AMAZING stars, this sounds like a wonderful movie.
Streep's character is running the paper, to my knowledge
I also enjoy these historical films, it is sort of like getting to see behind the curtain on things we typically do not get to see
Wow, never thought there was a female lead news editor in the 70s.
If I remember correctly, the paper was run by her family, so she sort of had an advantage. :)
Is it considered a historical film, drama?

It is considered as such. It is based on the true story of whether or not the press had the freedom to publish things of this nature, and whether the government could take actions to suppress the press.

Wow, this definitely sounds like a movie I would be interested in watching. 

Can you tell me anything else about the movie you feel is important
The movie received strong reviews... Rotten Tomatoes gave 88% and 7.9/10
CinemaScore gave an A
Ultimately, and despite being threatened to receive criminal charges from the government, Streep's character decides to run the story.
I love a strong movie where even despite the negative they go ahead and do what they feel is right.
This definitely happened here

Wow, rotten tomatoes score is very high.

When was the movie released? Seeing if it is something I can rent or purchase.
It was released in 2017, it should certainly be available for rent/purchase by now.
I will have to check to see if my local store has it.
If not there, there is always the Redbox. :)
Are you still there?
Yes, I was researching it. I have it on hold rental for later.
Great, I am sure you will enjoy it. It is a very interesting story.
Have you seen any other good movies laterly

uid2response.feedback: There were a lot of delays in the conversation, not sure if this was purposeful, or not.
